===Etymology 1===

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[enlargement]] or [[lump]] in the [[abdomen]]; in particular, [[splenomegaly]] or [[hepatomegaly]]
# {{lb|zh|TCM}} [[stuffiness]], [[fullness]] and [[discomfort]] in the [[epigastrium]]; [[dyspepsia]] or [[constipation]]
# {{lb|zh|dialectal Mandarin}} [[abdominal]] [[tumour]]

===Etymology 2===
"Bad" > "obscene; ferocious; rascal". Its use is most prominent in dialects of [[Hubei]] and [[Hunan]], and possibly originates from the ancient dialectal pronunciation of {{zh-l|*匪|bad, evil, bandit}}, same as Min Nan {{zh-l|*歹|phái(ⁿ)|bad}}.

It may be the origin of some uses of {{zh-l|皮}}, for example {{zh-l|*調皮|naughty}}, {{zh-l|*賴皮|shameless}} and {{zh-l|*頑皮|naughty}}.

The Cantonese pronunciation is probably due to confusion with {{zh-l|踎|mau1|to squat}}, as this word is not native to Cantonese.
